page.topic: Alpha Anywhere Architecture for Working with Other Databases
page.description: Alpha Anywhere provides two different connection methods for reading from and writing to other databases.

section.description: If you can create an ADO Data Link (using A5_CONNECTIONSTRING()), then you can connect to the database. These are some sample connection strings:

section.description: If you see the"Data Source" in the string, this is a clue that the connection uses ODBC.
AlphaDAO is an alternative to ADO. The principal differences are:

case.description: AlphaDAO supports "Portable SQL", which allows you to use the same SQL statement syntax on all databases.
AlphaDAO will ultimately run on other platforms. ADO runs only under Windows.
AlphaDAO has an Object Mode that is much easier to work with.
MySQL - Because Alpha Anywhere provides native MYSQL drivers, the user does not need to install MyODBC or create DSNs.
Oracle - Because Alpha Anywhere links to Oracle Instant Access, the user does not need to create DSNs.
SQL Server - The user does not need to create DSNs.
Generic ODBC - The user must create a DSN.
